title: JST, James 2
content: say he hath faith, and hath not works? can faith save him?
I will show thee I have faith without works; but I say,
Show me thy faith without works, and I will show thee my faith by my works.
if a brother or sister be naked and destitute, and one of you say, Depart in peace, be warmed and filled; notwithstanding
give not those things which are needful to the body; what profit
not works is dead, being alone.
wilt thou know, O vain man, that faith without works is dead
Thou believest there is one God; thou doest well; the devils also believe, and tremble;
thou hast made thyself like unto them, not being justified.
Was not Abraham our father justified by works, when he had offered Isaac his son upon the altar?
and by works was faith made perfect?
